@graph.reasoning: ConAgra attempted to enforce its patent for “A Method for Browning Precooked Whole Muscle Meat Products,” U. S. Patent No. 5,952,027 (’027 patent).

@graph.caseNumber: Walker Process Equipment, Inc. v. Food Machinery & Chemical Corp., 382 U. S. 172
@graph.reasoning: The enforcement of a patent procured by fraud on the Patent Ofﬁce may be violative of § 2 of the Sherman Act provided the other elements necessary to a § 2 case are present.

@graph.caseNumber: Biodex Corp. v. Loredan Biomedical, Inc., 946 F. 2d 850
@graph.reasoning: A party’s “failure to present the district court with a post-verdict motion precludes appellate review of sufﬁciency of the evidence.

@graph.caseNumber: Cummings v. General Motors Corp., 365 F. 3d 944
@graph.reasoning: A party that has failed to ﬁle a postverdict motion challenging the sufﬁciency of the evidence may nonetheless raise such a claim on appeal, so long as that party ﬁled a Rule 50(a) motion prior to submission of the case to the jury.
